Have just found out that most peers are using uTP, its whats slowing down the download. in utorrent to turn it off go to  options > preferences > brandwidth then Uncheck "Apply rate limit to uTP"   

uTP limits the amount of packets sent and received thus why its taking so bloody long

Ooooooh, brother... I don't even know where to start. The .avi file format was first introduced in 1992, so it's definitely NOT 1989 -.- And for portability's sake everybody please DO use .avi, because it's THE most videly recognised video file format. Most devices also play .mpeg, but if they do, you can just compress them into avi with minimal loss of quality. But what other formats should we use for "portability", "quality" and "modernity"? .mkv? I cannot name 10 persons I know that have a portable device that plays .mkv without a third-party program. So please, for the sake of "modernity", don't be ignorant, nor a fool (cuz I pity the fool...).
